intro: Psychotria ossaeana, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Psychotria ossaeana is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to confirm its medicinal properties.
